description: A 19th-century clay and mud-brick fort pivotal in Saudi history, notably recaptured by King Abdulaziz in 1902, marking the foundation of modern Saudi Arabia.
location: Located in the ad-Dirah district, central Riyadh.
todos: Explore the museum's collection of artifacts, maps, and weapons.
Visit the main gate with its distinctive palmwood door.
Observe the four watchtowers offering panoramic views.

description: The original home of the Saudi royal family and the first Saudi capital, featuring mud-brick architecture and recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
location: Northwestern outskirts of Riyadh, along Wadi Hanifa.
todos: Stroll through the historic At-Turaif district.
Visit Salwa Palace and Imam Mohammad bin Saud Mosque.
Learn about Saudi Arabia's early history at local museums.

description: A comprehensive museum showcasing Saudi Arabia's history, culture, art, and heritage through diverse exhibits.
location: Part of the King Abdulaziz Historical Center in central Riyadh.
todos: Explore eight main galleries covering Arabian history.
View ancient artifacts, manuscripts, and interactive displays.
Participate in educational programs and workshops.

description: Built in the 1930s, this palace served as King Abdulaziz's residence and office, exemplifying traditional Najdi architecture.
location: Adjacent to the National Museum within the King Abdulaziz Historical Center.
todos: Tour the restored rooms and halls of the palace.
Examine personal belongings of King Abdulaziz on display.
Appreciate the traditional Najdi architectural elements.

description: A natural limestone hill featuring a distinctive oval hole at its summit, surrounded by urban parkland.
location: In the ad-Dubbat neighborhood, overlooking the al-Malazz district.
todos: Hike to the summit for panoramic city views.
Relax in the surrounding park area.
Learn about the site's historical significance.

description: A cultural complex dedicated to the history of Saudi Arabia, featuring museums, libraries, and beautifully landscaped gardens.
location: Located in the al-Murabba district, central Riyadh.
todos: Visit the King Abdulaziz Memorial Hall.
Explore the Saudi heritage exhibits.
Walk through the lush gardens and fountains.

description: One of the oldest markets in Riyadh, dating back over 100 years, known for traditional goods, antiques, spices, and handicrafts.
location: Located in the ad-Dirah district, near Al Masmak Fortress.
todos: Shop for authentic Saudi antiques and handicrafts.
Experience the traditional Saudi market atmosphere.
Bargain with local vendors for the best deals.

description: A 120 km-long valley with historical significance, featuring restored parks, palm groves, and traditional farms.
location: Stretches across western Riyadh, with key spots in Diriyah.
todos: Walk along the scenic trails.
Visit historic settlements and farms.
Relax by the water features and enjoy a picnic.

description: A cultural and artistic landmark featuring large-scale murals that depict the history and heritage of Saudi Arabia.
location: Stretching along Old Airport Road in central Riyadh.
todos: Take a walk and admire the street art.
Capture photos of Saudi heritage through the murals.
Explore the artistic expressions of local artists.
